message_1:
A medical research team collected data on the blood pressure readings of 50 patients at their clinic. The blood pressure readings were as follows:

120, 135, 128, 150, 143, 132, 124, 136, 129, 141, 131, 142, 124, 136, 141, 130, 139, 133, 121, 144, 139, 132, 137, 126, 140, 128, 147, 131, 123, 129, 136, 138, 133, 127, 146, 131, 142, 124, 136, 141, 130, 139, 133, 121, 144, 139, 132, 137, 126, 140, 128, 147

Find the mean, the median, and the mode blood pressure readings for the patients.
message_2:
To find the mean, median, and mode, we first need to organize the data and find the sum of all the blood pressure readings.

Organized data:
120, 121, 121, 123, 124, 124, 124, 126, 126, 127, 128, 128, 128, 129, 129, 130, 130, 131, 131, 131, 132, 132, 132, 133, 133, 133, 135, 136, 136, 136, 137, 137, 138, 139, 139, 139, 140, 140, 141, 141, 141, 142, 142, 143, 144, 144, 146, 147, 147, 150

Sum of blood pressure readings: 6780

Mean: The mean is the sum of the blood pressure readings divided by the number of readings. There are 50 readings.

Mean = 6780 / 50 = 135.6

Median: The median is the middle value in the organized data. Since there are 50 readings (an even number), the median will be the average of the 25th and 26th values.

Median = (132 + 133) / 2 = 132.5

Mode: The mode is the value that appears most frequently in the data. In this case, there are three values that appear most frequently (3 times each): 124, 128, and 136.

Mode = 124, 128, 136

So, the mean blood pressure reading is 135.6, the median is 132.5, and the mode is 124, 128, and 136.
